alert.note: Alert for Blaine; Canadian (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 09 at 8:11AM CDT until July 10 at 11:38AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Oklahoma... North Canadian River near Watonga affecting Blaine and Canadian Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...North Canadian River near Watonga. * WHEN...Until late tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 17.0 feet, Flooding of croplands...pastures... and rural roads occurs. The floodwaters extend from near Watonga in Blaine County... downstream to near Calumet in western Canadian County. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:30 AM CDT Sunday the stage was 15.2 feet. - Bankfull stage is 13.0 feet. - Forecast...The North Canadian River is expected to rise to a crest of 16.9 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage late tonight. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 815 PM CDT.
